pros: Nice team members, good benefits
cons: Slow paced environment, old hospital

pros: Helping the community and bring in my knowledge and my experience
cons: Human Resourse try to run the Security Department and the Director of Secricurity, you can't have both ways...

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Culpeper, VA
pros: Low patient to staff acuity.
cons: Management allows bullying among staff, cussing and lack of respect for patients, lack of skin examination and care, lack of care by doctors: Doctors do not fully answer patient questions or show genuine care for the patients.

review_title: very political good ole boy/girl network. Lots of money spent on marketing, little on internal improvements for staff
pros: Good insurance benefits are about it.
cons:
Very political - small town politics control how others like you/treat you. Haughty upper management think they are better than others in so many ways. Lots of lip service by management.
Very poor employee support, crappy food, kangaroo court dictates the blame game,

pros: Good culture based on small town values. Emphasis on  customer service. Decent management. Good vibe for the most part.
cons: Raises are skimpy. Management spends more money on infrastructure and baubles.

review_title: Great experience, great atmosphere, great people.
pros: Payscale is above average, you are not just a number, your opinion counts.  Hard work is rewarded.
cons: Smaller hospital, so not all of the opportunities a larger medical center can offer, but they might be a pro in some respects.

job_title: X Ray Tech in Culpeper, VA
pros: People are friendly and professional
cons: Hours have been cutback, wages have been frozen, employer no longer contributes to retirement plan.
